comment: Professor Coleman is an amazing history professor! She is super helpful, and responds fairly quickly. She is passionate about history makes it easier to learn. She gives out a mapping project and research essay for World Civilization II, but she reminds you to start it every class.  She gives out study guides, so study that & you are good to go!

She is a very sweet spoken lady that has a very calm personality. The tests aren't that hard if you pay attention, but you must spend some time studying as well. She listens well when other students are talking and really wants her students to learn. She isn't the easiest class, but definitely worth taking. i'm not great at history but i did well.

She does expect you to work hard. I spent a lot of time studying, but it paid off. I made A's on all of the tests. I learned SO much in this class. She really knows her stuff, and she's passionate about it. If you're not afraid to really study, then take her for sure!

Professor Coleman isnt hard. She just expects a lot. If you put in the effort and do the study guide youll be okay. just study and put in the work and youll be fine. if you dont, you will fail. she cares about her students and will help you if you need it. Just Ask and start the mapping project early.
I would not recommend this professor if you're looking for an easy A. This course required entirely too much work for a general requirement.
Test are hard. Go to every class and write down Discussion Questions. START THE MAPPING PROJECT EARLY!!!

Mrs. Coleman is such a sweet lady and she really knows her stuff. Her class is not easy though. You really have to pay attention, write down the DQs and READ THE TEXTBOOK.  I worked my tail off and have made 2 high As and a high B on her exams and I am in no way a history buff. So I'm living proof that her class is passable IF YOU WORK HARD.

I really like this teacher, because she's engaging with her class and won't bore you. However, you do need to read the book and take notes before class, because she will have pop quizzes sometimes. The tests are easy if you actually write down the discussion questions she gives you and answer them. Her tests are easy if study from her power points.

Find a different professor! Her tests are insane, even if you attend EVERY class, read the entire chapter, and take detailed notes, the tests are extremely difficult. Do NOT talk, or smile or anything in class. My friend and I were kicked out of the classroom for smiling. If at all possible AVOID  this professor!!!!!!!!

Find another teacher, she is not very good. Attendance is mandatory. She doesn't even teach some of the material on the tests. You HAVE to take very good notes AND read the book to even have a chance on her tests...and her tests are worded extremely confusingly. Just spare yourself and find another teacher. I worked my tail off and got an 81.

Show up.Read the book.Take notes on chapters before covered in class.Study text and Discussion Questions.Test questions are analytical so know EVERYTHING backward and forward.Not an easy "A" but do-able.Start the Mapping Project early.Approachable. Has a complex.Dont talk in class.She will call you out.Talks down to the second.Made an "A"

Prof. Coleman is not an easy teacher, but she is a good one. The hardest part of her tests are the depth they take. Study really hard, including her DQs and powerpoints. Start the mapping project EARLY!! as early as you can. If you're doing bad it might be able to save you. Show up to class-take notes on the readings before you show up.

Hardest tests I've taken in a LONG time. I read the book, studied her ppt lecture  notes, took my own notes, and still failed most of her tests. There's also required reading each class and she has pop quizzes on the reading. You can use your notes for these, but they're usually pretty difficult. She's very sweet, but I would NOT recommend her.
avoid this professor. tests are extremely hard even after hours of studying. you have to know EVERY detail about every dynasty, ruler ect. for a gen-ed class i thought it was ridiculous

Most people complained that tests were hard, but I found them pretty easy. Her pop quiz and attendance policy is stupid. Doesn't answer questions well during class. 4 tests and a project, along with 4 pop quizes that make up way to much of the final grade.

You'll have to actually study. She covered the material thoroughly, and made it interesting. It is definitely a lecture-based class with very little room for discussion, but since she has so much to cover in so little time, that's understandable. Very approachable, easy to make appointments with her. I thought she was a great teacher.
She is a horrible professor. She just reads off of her PowerPoints and shows a movie clip. Her class is extremely boring, and it is very difficult. Her tests are absolutely ridiculous.

Her class is extremely boring! Her tests are much harder than they should be. I got ap credit for the class in high school, and still find the tests difficult. I havent attended class in 2 months because of how boring it is.

One of the worst history classes I've taken. Mrs. Coleman somehow makes one of the easiest classes difficult for no reason which completely is unnecessary for this class. Avoid her if you can. Awful powerpoints every single class.
Forget it. Find a different Professor
Very hard for a Gen-ed class. Must buy textbook. Avoid her if you can.

She is very predictable in her teaching. Same style lectures every class. It becomes hard to focus on the imformation in her class. You MUST read every chapter we discuss as well as come to EVERY class to get discussion questions (that will be on test). Personally not a fun class for me.

Avoid this teacher at all costs! She flies through power points, doesn't review anything. The study guides for the tests have nothing to do with the tests! Discussion questions are on the test but the questions are so in depth its impossible to answer them right. You will be very unhappy taking this class with her.

Coleman made this class EXTREMELY hard. Power points are bullet points and arent relevant to tests. Tests are based off of discussion questions which she never goes over so you have no idea what she is looking for on the tests. Book is your Bible. I failed every test and made a C. Almost impossible to make a good grade on anything. I dontrecommend.

This class was not easy, but you definitely learn a lot from it. She is very willing to help you, and answer any questions. You definitely have to study. I didn't read the book, and I still managed to make a B. Overall, it is a good challenging class. If you want an easy A, don't takes this class.

I would recommend this professor. She is caring and understanding. She has kids, so she knows grades really impact people. I failed one test, the research paper, and the final, and still got a B in the class.
VERY hard class! If you don't take the time to study, read, or do the work you will NOT pass the class! If you take her class be prepared to study a LOT!

VERY hard class, especially for a gen ed course. She says "ummmm" every 2 seconds which is annoying. Lectures are so boring! Everyone did really bad on the first test so she had to make it weigh less than she planned. Most people failed the second test too! She doesn't realize she is a crappy teacher.

Probably hardest class I've had in a while. Gives study guides that have nothing to do with the test. Her lectures are boring and tests are extremely hard. So many students failed the first test that she had to change the weighting of the grades so projects weigh more than tests. Will be getting my first C since middle school.
Always Ran out of time in class. Spent way too much time on unimportant topics and no time on test topics. Most of the test questions were on topics we did not learn in class.

ignore what others say- yes, you do have to study in her class & attendance is mandatory, but if you just show up and do the study guides you can get a good grade. i failed every test and walked out with a B+ b/c of her extra assignments she gives. Dont take her if you dont want to try; but if you dont have issues with LEARNING, then take her.

I had alot of fun taking this class. She gives you a study guide and most of the terms are on the test. No surprises. Some involved projects. I saw a lot of people not do well because they actually had to come to class and take notes. If you are a good note taker and understand the important points it is a fairly easy class. Plus she's really nice!

If you enjoy listening to some of the crazy things that happened in the past you'll do fine because it will be easier to remember some of the people and places. If you have no interest in history then you won't do well and probably complain all of the time. A lot of assignments but talk to her after class she tells you exactly what she wants.
No Comments

In summary: AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Grades unfairly, takes attendance EVERY day, goes too fast thru powerpts that you can't even TYPE fast enough. Coleman doesn't put ANYTHING on WebCT - NOTHING, even when we asked her to. 1st test was on 6 WKS OF MATERIAL. Class avg was 67, she only curved 2 pts. Requires way too much for Gen Ed class. TERRIBLE PROF.

I could go ON AND ON. But basically: TERRIBLE. Grades unfairly, takes attendance EVERY DAY, and she WILL NOT put ANYTHING online. Class avg on first test was 67, & she was ok w/that. Clicks thru powerpts. extremely fast. I'm on the Dean's List, so I do try hard at school. I read, took notes, studied 7 hrs, went to class & got a 73 on her test.
